intro: Callista anceps, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Flacourtiaceae and is characterized by its fibrous, woody stems that are used for weaving traditional Māori garments. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are long, narrow, and often have a bluish-green hue. Callista anceps is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
